mdRecord.dcterms:title: Fountain of Youth Archaeological Park, exterior|general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: It has been touted as the likely 1513 Florida landing site of Spanish explorer Ponce de Leon, although no evidence has been found to substantiate this claim. [work]

The park contains a well claimed to be the freshwater source referred to by Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas in his "Historia general ..." and supposedly sought by Ponce de Leon, but there is no supporting evidence. Archaeological excavations on the park's grounds in the 1990s uncovered remains of the first Spanish settlement and its fortifications in St. Augustine. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fountain_of_Youth_Archaeological_Park [work]
